summary: if a foreigner has been previously approved to reside in the r.o.c. before his/her employment engaged in the professional work, does he/she still meet the requirement of "the first time... in the r.o.c. for the purpose of work"? if a foreigner has been previously approved to reside in the r.o.c. before his/her employment engaged in professional work in the r.o.c., such approval is not given because of his/her engagement in the professional work (such as residence for study or as dependents); therefore, the foreigner is exempt from the first-time approval limitation.
